course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Environmental Law and Regulations
course.description: The course will provide students with the basic legal concepts which include the hierarchy of courts in Hong Kong, the difference between civil and criminal proceedings, their possible redresses or remedies available from the courts, and the relationship between environmental science and law within the environmental law regime. Important provisions of the basic environmental legislation in Hong Kong, environmental prosecution policy of Hong Kong and how to investigate a judicial review against a ministerial decision relating to the environment will also be covered in the course.

reviews.author: lamok
reviews.title: Best Professor I met in ENVR department
reviews.comment_content:
I simply copied the course outline to here:
Introduction to the legal system of Hong Kong;
Civil and Criminal Law – their distinctions
How to read : (i) a piece of legislation; and (ii) a judicial precedent;
Basic concepts on statutory interpretation and construction
Environmental legislation I : Air Pollution Control Ordinance Cap.311;
Environmental legislation II : Noise Control Ordinance Cap.400;
Environmental legislation III : Water Pollution Control Ordinance Cap.358;
Environmental legislation IV : Waste Disposal Ordinance Cap.354;
Environmental legislation V : Dumping at Sea Ordinance Cap.466
Environmental legislation VI : Environmental Impact Assessment Ordinance Cap.499;
Liability of company and its directors: Introduction to companies law in the perspective of environmental legislation
The first few lectures were the most interesting and important which provide you a solid base in the legal system in Hong Kong. If you found it interesting in the first several lectures then you will love to learn more about law. Most of the law were illustrated with cases and they are very interesting. The Ordinances were taught with cases so there were a lot of printed material as well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. PONG is very talented and I can see his passion for teaching. He came to teach in UST after his work and sometimes he didn't even have dinner. He is also very caring and willing to answer students' questions.
However, there was not much chance to have him as our lecturer since he was sometimes busy and he found somebody works in EPD to give the lecture.
Tbh, I enjoy Prof. PONG's lecture more than the others.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure about others but I got a relatively good grade. Prof. PONG is very generous in giving out bonus points when you are brave enough to answer his question during classes. No need to worry whether it is right or wrong, just revise a bit before each class and give the answer when he asks questions.
No attendance but you should go to the class to enjoy and learn (Wednesday 7-10pm)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is ok for me. Only one assignment and one presentation. Due to the situation in Hong Kong, the presentation and the final exam was canceled. Instead, we submitted a group work of a list of questions and a case.

reviews.author: kimbasilioo
reviews.comment_content: He is by far one of the most interesting professors who shows passion for the course. He did have a few guest lecturers, but they were not as great compared to him. The content itself is very relevant to environmental ordinances in Hong Kong and uses case studies to demonstrate how they would apply in the real-world. He also gave us the opportunity to do a court visit to sit in real trials. The content was hard to grasp at first, such as the basics of law AND Hong Kong environmental ordinances. But once you get over the learning curve, you will find that the course is super interesting and relevant
reviews.comment_teaching: HE WAS AMAZING! He is passionate, interesting, and funny!
reviews.comment_grading: Although I didn't think I did too well in the final, I still ended up in the A-range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much at ALL. Just make sure you don't falter behind and keep up with the material so that it doesn't come crashing down on you during the last few weeks.
We had TWO individual assignments, ONE presentation, and ONE final exam. That's it.
